div.head: Proposition 27
div.p: The Castilian monarchs are obligated by divine law to put government over the natural peoples of the Indies. This government must maintain their just laws and good customs, and remove bad ones (which werenâ€™t many), and add any defects in their policy (mostly preaching the Gospel) towards spreading the faith and prospering the peoples of the Americas. The Castilian monarchs are to sacrifice much their own material34 interests and income, so that those peoples might be helped and not impeded with regard to the spiritual. This includes their conversion and receiving of our catholic faith, and the exercise of the holy sacraments of the Church. Justice and rights should also be upheld for them. Moreover, they should be principally increased and prospered in their bodily life, and in everything which pertains to their material good. This is the ultimate cause for which, or reason why, the Castilian monarchs were given these lands (none of which they had anything in before)
